synopsis.text:
Chance upon a captivating journey in the music video "4-Day Weekend," a masterful blend of traditional 2D animation and cutting-edge computer graphics, directed by Koji Morimoto of the renowned Studio 4Â°C. This award-winning clip features the enthralling song of the same name by the English group The Bluetones, which was uniquely distributed solely via the internet.

As the video unfolds, we are introduced to a couple deeply in love, enjoying their time together in a serene cityscape. Suddenly, the tranquility of their surroundings begins to shift, revealing a darker, more mechanical world hidden beneath the surface. The once-familiar streets transform into a maze of spinning gears and ominous shadows, as the city's inhabitants give way to haunting spirits.

Amidst the chaos, the pair finds themselves separated, leaving them to navigate this new reality in search of one another. Will they manage to reunite, or are they forever destined to chase the elusive, fragile bubbles that float through the air?

"4-Day Weekend" is a visual and auditory feast that pushes the boundaries of animation, captivating viewers with its intriguing narrative and artistic prowess. Recognized as the "Best Music Video" at the Holland Animation Festival 98, this groundbreaking clip is a must-see for fans of innovative storytelling and animation techniques.
